text:
India celebrates its 69th Independence Day with great zeal and fervor Published on : Saturday, August 15, 2015
India is celebrating its 69th Independence Day today.
Over 12,000 of these personnel have been deployed in high-security areas – especially in and around the Red Fort from where Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation on Saturday. This multi-layered security cover in the national capital ahead of Independence Day, is keeping vigil across the city against any possible terror strike. Around 5,000 personnel from the local police, Special Cell and security wing of the Delhi Police have been deployed, apart from the 30,000 personnel who have been deployed in other parts of the capital to maintain law and order. The number of CCTV cameras have been increased to extensively cover the route that was taken by the prime minister and other dignitaries to reach the fort, as reported by the officer in charge.
Independence Day is celebrated all over the India as a National holiday of India. It is observed every year in every Indian states and union territories with great enthusiasm. President of India gives a speech every year in order to “Address to the Nation” on the evening of a day before the Independence Day. Flag hoisting, National Anthem song play and parade ceremonies including other cultural programmes takes place in almost all the governmental and non-governmental institutions, educational institutions.
At this day, all the national, states and local government’s offices, banks, post offices, markets, stores, businesses, organizations, etc remains closed to celebrate the world’s largest democracy’s Independence Day. However, public transport is totally unaffected. It is celebrated in the capital of India with big enthusiasm however it is also celebrated in the schools, colleges and other educational institutions including public community and society.
